title.translation_en: A common starting point for an office worker's f***ing overtime #shorts

summary.text: This viral short masterfully uses an anthropomorphic hamster to depict the universally relatable emotional rollercoaster of being forced to work overtime. The narrative follows 'Kim Hamjji' from the initial hope of leaving work, through the despair of a last-minute assignment, a brief resurgence of will, and a catastrophic computer error, culminating in a hilarious breakdown. The final punchline, revealing the boss was on vacation, adds a layer of tragic irony that deeply resonates with audiences familiar with corporate absurdities. The video's success lies in its perfect blend of cute visuals, high-pitched comedic voice acting, and a deeply relatable scenario from Korean work culture.

description.text: The hook establishes a relatable hope. A cute hamster office worker calculates that since a meeting is over, it's time to go home. This creates an immediate, positive expectation that is primed to be dramatically subverted, drawing the viewer in to see what will inevitably go wrong.

The video follows a classic five-act structure compressed into under a minute: Setup (hope of leaving), Inciting Incident (overtime assignment), Rising Action (struggle and self-motivation), Climax (file error and breakdown), and Resolution/Twist (the boss was absent).

role.text: The protagonist is an anthropomorphic hamster who embodies the archetypal junior office worker: diligent, easily stressed, and subject to the whims of management. His emotional volatility drives the comedic narrative.

The primary antagonist is the unseen 'Timjangnim' (Team Leader) whose casual request triggers the conflict. A secondary antagonist is the computer error, representing the impersonal cruelty of technology that betrays the protagonist at his most vulnerable moment.

description.text: The entire premise is built around 'Yageun' (working overtime), a prevalent and often stressful aspect of South Korean corporate culture. The video's title, '야근 시발점' (Yageun Sibaljeom), is a pun on '시작점' (sijakjeom - starting point) and the curse '시발' (ssibal), translating to 'f***ing starting point of overtime,' which immediately signals its comedic and critical tone to a Korean audience.

The hamster's instant, high-pitched '네! (Yes!)' is captioned as '자동 반사 (automatic reflex),' humorously depicting the conditioned, unquestioning obedience of a junior employee to a superior's request, regardless of personal inconvenience.

The final punchline relies on the concept of 'Yeoncha' (annual leave/paid day off). The colleague's revelation that the team leader was on leave makes the hamster's entire night of suffering absurd and pointless, a common feeling in large organizations.

audience_psychology.overall_sentiment: Overwhelmingly positive, hilarious, and highly relatable
common_reactions: Intense empathy and relatability regarding the pains of overtime.
Finding the high-pitched, soul-filled voice acting, especially the cursing, extremely funny.
Praising the juxtaposition of the cute hamster visuals with the dark, stressful reality of office life.
Sharing personal stories of similar work-related catastrophes.

notable_comments.translation_en: The 'Don't f*** with me' is dubbed with real soul lolololol
The 'Don't f*** with me' is so funny lolololol
What the heck is 'FUCKEN do it' lololol
The hamster's voice is so cute
The overtime situation is so realistic

asr_transcript.translation_en: Ah.. the meeting is over, so it's 6 o'clock? Then, time to go home... (Boss: Mr. Hamjji, let's review that research item from the meeting by tomorrow!) ... Yes! (Automatic reflex)... Then... overtime... Save! ... Argh! Hey! Don't f*** with me! Don't f*** with me!!!!!!! ... (Colleague: Huh?! But the team leader is on annual leave today?)
asr_transcript.excerpt: 아.. 회의 끝나니까 여섯시? 그렇다면 퇴근.. (팀장님: 햄찌씨, 회의에서 나온 리서치 건 내일 중으로 한번 보자!) .. 넵! (자동 반사).. 그렇다면.. 야근.. 저장! .. 으악! 야! 지랄하지마! 지랄하지마!!!!!!! .. (동료: 어?! 오늘 팀장님 연차인데?)

ocr_results.translation_en: A common starting point for an office worker's f***ing overtime

evidence.text: The laptop used by the hamster is clearly identifiable as a Macbook Pro, with the brand name visible below the screen in one shot.
The hamster wears large, silver over-ear headphones identical in design to Apple's AirPods Max throughout the overtime sequence.
A logo resembling the Jansport brand is visible on the small backpack the hamster is holding at the end.

summary.text: The video opens by establishing the protagonist hamster's joyful anticipation of leaving the office for the day. This hope is immediately and brutally crushed by a last-minute overtime assignment from his boss, conveyed through voiceover, sending the hamster into a state of resigned despair.

notes: The shot establishes the character in an office environment, wearing a tiny ID badge to signify his role as an employee.

keyframes.description: A medium shot of the hamster standing near an office door, looking slightly up and to the side with a hopeful expression. On-screen text: '오.. (Oh..)'
Quick cut to a close-up of the hamster looking at a laptop screen (off-camera). On-screen text: '회의 끝나니까 6시 (The meeting ends at 6 o'clock)'
Extreme close-up on the hamster's face, eyes wide with determination and joy. On-screen text: '그렇다면 퇴근 (Then, time to go home)'. This is the peak moment of hope.

notes: A series of rapid extreme close-ups are used to emphasize the hamster's dramatic emotional shift from shock to reflexive obedience and finally to utter despair.
The use of on-screen text like '(자동 반사)' (automatic reflex) provides comedic commentary on the action.

keyframes.description: The boss's voiceover begins. The hamster's expression shifts from hope to alarm, eyes widening as it processes the request.
The hamster gives a reflexive, high-pitched '넵! (Yes!)', its whole body twitching with the effort of the forced agreement. Text: '(자동 반사) (Automatic reflex)'.
The hamster's face falls into an expression of dawning horror and misery. Text: '그렇다면.. 야근 (Then.. overtime)'.
The hamster is shown at a desk, looking at the clock which reads 10:50 PM, highlighting the passage of time and the extent of the overtime.

summary.text: This scene depicts the climax of the hamster's suffering and the final ironic twist. After nearly finishing his work, a catastrophic computer error deletes his progress, leading to a frantic, profanity-laced breakdown. The next morning, a colleague reveals the boss who assigned the task was on vacation, rendering the entire ordeal meaningless.

notes: The sequence intercuts between the hamster's face and the laptop screen to build tension and show the cause of its distress.
The sound design, featuring a system error chime, the spinning wheel sound, and the hamster's screams, is critical to the comedic effect.

keyframes.description: A shot of the Macbook Pro screen shows a presentation titled 'Corp Research' with a system 'Error' dialog box popping up. A sharp error sound plays.
The hamster stares in horror as the macOS 'spinning beach ball of death' appears. It lets out a high-pitched scream: '아!!!!!!!!!! (Ah!!!!!!!!!!)'
An intense extreme close-up on the hamster's mouth as it screams the climactic line: 'ㅈㅣ랄하지마!!!!!!!!!! (Don't f*** with me!!!!!!!!!!)'.
After a moment of despair, the hamster rallies itself, shouting '정신차렷!!!!!!!!!!!!!! (Get a grip!!!!!!!!!!!!!!)' before grabbing a fictional 'SOL' energy drink.
Re-energized, the hamster types furiously, with its internal monologue stating it must finish the work no matter what.

notes: The scene shifts to a wider shot the next day to include the colleague, setting up the final dialogue-based punchline.
The hamster's exhausted, zombie-like appearance contrasts with the normal office environment.

keyframes.description: The hamster, looking utterly drained, greets a female colleague in the now bright office.
The colleague expresses shock upon hearing the hamster worked overtime the previous night.
The colleague covers her mouth in surprise and delivers the punchline: '오늘 팀장님 연차인데? (But the team leader is on annual leave today?)'.
Extreme close-up on the hamster's face, frozen in a state of pure, empty-eyed shock as the realization sinks in. The video ends on this frame.
